channel.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
channel.description: So I've got a lawnmower in my backyard that's in disrepair. Sure, I could fix it easily if I knew what was wrong with it, right? Well that's just it. I don't know what's wrong with it. It's been in my back yard for about a year, and wasn't covered during snow/rain/etc. So obviously the oil and gas is as good as gone. But that isn't what is wrong with it. How could one go about repairing it?

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Impressive^.
I wish I could say I’ve flown a lawnmower before :(.

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:31, topic:519819”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=638315.msg4311132#msg4311132 date=1370750839]
Spark plug is usually 5/8. Change the spark plug, the air filter, gas, and oil. If it doesn’t work then buy a new mower.
[/quote]

Everybody’s talking like it’s a car now ;o[/quote]

Uh, maybe because it has a gas engine. Kinda like a car.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:27, topic:519819”]If you have some 20th century lawnmower all i can say is why… get a new one you can get a nice cheaply one for $150 .

How’s you carburetor then?[/quote]
It’s 3:32AM. Way to dark to go look at it.

-I’m working on getting a job. If I can I’m going to get a new lawnmower, eventually.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:25, topic:519819”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=638315.msg4302457#msg4302457 date=1369211072]

Looks like you have stuff jamming the air pipe. If it’s trying to start up but won’t that’s still good news I guess because it’s not completely dead! Have you got enough fuel and what’s the battery like?

Check your carburetor adjustment and your choke to see whether the choke is first closing and then opening. If you have fuel injection just buy a new lawn mower you anit gonna be able to fix it.

Fuel Injection? This lawn mower is old ha. It’s not going to have any fancy shit lol.
[/quote]
Not even nitro:/?[/quote]
Nope… [size=1pt]not yet[/size]

Read full topic

item.description:

Looks like you have stuff jamming the air pipe. If it’s trying to start up but won’t that’s still good news I guess because it’s not completely dead! Have you got enough fuel and what’s the battery like?

Check your carburetor adjustment and your choke to see whether the choke is first closing and then opening. If you have fuel injection just buy a new lawn mower you anit gonna be able to fix it.

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Probably your gas/oil mixture is bad. Try putting starter fluid in the carb just to get it running, then run it high power to drain the gas. Once it’s gone just run fuel stabilizer with a new mix of gas and fuel. The starter fluid should start it/

Can’t do anything tonight. I’ll work on it tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Probably your gas/oil mixture is bad. Try putting starter fluid in the carb just to get it running, then run it high power to drain the gas. Once it’s gone just run fuel stabilizer with a new mix of gas and fuel. The starter fluid should start it/

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

could be a few different sizes just get a socket set if you have one and find the correct one

I’m actually going to bed soon so good luck with the rest of your endeavor and I’ll check back in the morning before work to see how things went over. Take the plug out tho see if theres any corrosion or what not around the tip, make sure theres a gap between the prong and the tip and if it all checks out throw it back in or replace it up to you. Make sure you snap that spark plug wire back in tight and check the other end of the wire for corrosion and looseness as well. Try priming it a bit more and some more hard pulls.

Spark/Air/Fuel

see if you can find the air filter next

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

What size wrench does it take?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

You should see a rubber wire on the side of the mower follow that and it will be connected to the spark plug, Remove the wire and then use a socket to take out the spark plug. This is good experience for you to be honest so keep going you’ll get a life lesson out of it eventually.


Thats what the wire looks like and where the general area is on most lawn mowers

I can see it on the front of your second pic actually right in the middle.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t even know where the spark plug is

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:519819”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=638315.msg4302281#msg4302281 date=1369184895]

So the rip cord works… Idk what’s up with it, but it gets stuck but you can pull and it’s moves, eventually. It almost sounds like it wants to start though.

Pull the cord back and forth a few times to ease it up since its probably been sitting there for quite a while then prime it and hold the safty lever and give it some good pulls.
[/quote]
That’s what I was doing. It sounded like it wanted to start, but just wouldn’t[/quote]
If you have the tools available I’d pull the spark plug and see what it looks like since theres a possibility it could be worn out and may need to be replaced. Spark plugs can be picked up for less than 5$ if you wanted to just get a new one.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing a lawnmower?
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:519819”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=638315.msg4302265#msg4302265 date=1369183424]
Remove whatever is covering the cord and see whats going on in there.
[/quote]
The bolt is rusted and crap so… This’ll take a min.[/quote]
Dont break the bolt get some pb blaster or wd40 to loosen it up a tad and work it back and forth, most likely you’ll want to put it back on.

Make sure you’re holding down the safety lever at the top of the handle bar too.

Read full topic
